f6_assessments.q0: This is a great proposal; Rodolfo clearly understands the problem faced and has laid out objectives strongly aligned with the challenge. It is noticeable the potential this proposal has in adding value to the Cardano environment. If accomplished this plan will be responsible for a plug-in that is readily available for millions of users. Not only it will make ADA payments commonplace, but it will also bring awareness to the Cardano environment and all of its uses to the rest of the people not engaged with cryptocurrencies yet. The KPIs defined are closely connected with the roadmap traced and are a good measure of progress. Nonetheless there are a few points missing that would enrich the proposal even more. For instance, concerns about scalability, quality of the integration, percentage of success in the transactions and user-friendly experience are vaguely touched or not touched at all.
f6_assessments.q1: Rodolfo has provided enough evidence of his skills and experience to signal he has the capacity to implement the proposal. The plan clearly breaks down the steps necessary to reach a successful conclusion and even though the workhours are slightly overpriced the overall budget is pretty reasonable. The timetable shown is bit bold and fast-paced, but still acceptable. Additionally, the main risk identified is fairly discussed and in the worst-case scenario it would mean the project would take longer than expected. Also, in this case, the additional funding necessary would come from the original fund. In other words, it would be diluted.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress of the project. Great KPIs were defined that will help keep track of the pace of the plan. For every stage of the project there will be a KPI to assist this tracking. The roadmap built is well structured and the milestones are clearly defined. The time horizon sounds a bit short, what would mean the rhythm of work would be accelerated. The only point missing is KPIs regarding the success of the proposal. Ratio of transactions completed over total transactions, scalability without loss of quality and number of merchants that can be integrated are a few that would contribute a lot to the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
I agree that this proposal fits in quite well with the challenge settings. The solution to integrate Odoo with AdaPay is different from all the other proposals in this category. 

My preference, however, would have been that we have a generic plugin solution that could also be integrate with other platforms and not only Odoo, as one of the key metrics to measure is that "total amount of e-commerce plaforms that can be integrated into the new component" . 

However, i think the solution proposed here fits into the challenge category and effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The experience of the proposer ( an MS from stanford) is very good and the public profile on linked in and github activities support that notion.

The plan presented here is split into steps, and each step gives a good insight on the proposer thought process behind the proposed plan.

The project duration given in my opinion is well justified, and i think the budget outlined is also good in terms of the effort to cost ratio for such an implementation. (As mostly Coti API does the heavy lifting and plugin just has to implement the business logic for payment solution). 

I would have, however, liked to see more into testability/scalability of the resulting plugin and how it will cover these aspects along with user feedback. Those details are somehow missing, and would have been nice to have those additional points in there. Therefore, i see some room for improvement in the write up for this proposal. 

All in all, in my opinion highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
I strongly agree that the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and success of this proposal.

The proposer has given good details on the tracking. He plans to use that Agile methodologies, and Jira cloud tools. In my opinion, this is a good way to keep track of the milestones and feature sets that are going to be implemented and where we are on the bigger timeframe.

The github repo will be public, and it will be easy to see what kind of activities are happening based on the commit/Pull requests history on the repository.
The KPIs are given in the proposal, which will give community an upfront confidence on what should be the success criterion be like. These indicators are in alignment with the challenge settings success criterion, therefore an overall full points from my side.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a strong proposal and clearly aligns with the challenge objectives that COTI has outlined in the brief.   This proposal specifically benefits from its ability to clearly define what the impact and metric of success looks like - the ability to build the ADA Pay plugin with Odoo. 

The proposer has also identified a compelling and novel case study to experiment the use of ADA Pay integration process. Through using an open source solution as the backbone of this experiment, ADA Pay will have the potential to tap into a 7 million deep user base in the future as transactions volumes through cryptocurrencies increase.  

Another strength of this proposal was the way it addressed the potential risks associated with the project.  They have incorporated this as a buffer into the project budget to deal with this. 

In order to round out this proposal, it could have benefited from extending the scope of the experiment to include the engagement of the Odoo community after the plugin is built. At the end of the day, COTI is also interested in the use of ADA Pay beyond the integration of it.  At least a consideration of this component would have been beneficial to further understand the longevity of this proposal and the ability to scale and address future challenges.

This positively signals a strong understanding of the entire funding process and the expectations that are required for success. f6_assessments.q2: A key strength of this proposal is the simplicity in detailing key information such as the roadmap, estimated time of key activities delivered (in hours)  and details on budget allocation.  Finally, the proposer shows a strong understanding of how to make the project auditable through the use of JIRA (a project management tool). This will further enable an audit trail of how the project activities and streams are progressing over the course of the 6 week scope.

f6_assessments.q0: By suggesting an AdaPay plugin for the very popular opensource ecommerce toolkit Odoo, this proposal successfully finds a niche in COTI's campaign brief, and makes a good fit for the community at large by addressing a neglected market.  With BitPay and Coinbase Commerce apps in development on Odoo, now is a good time to rollout the security of COTI's AdaPay.  The only drawback I see is that 17% of the overall Fund7 budget for COTI may be a high price to pay for a single plugin for a userbase of 5-7 million, versus a Shopify level userbase of +60mil.  With that caveat, deploying AdaPay into any opensource (re: engaged community) pool is always a good idea, and with Odoo, ADA, and thus Cardano, has an opportunity to dominate where other crypto contributors have lagged.
f6_assessments.q1: Despite being a one-man team, this proposal looks to be backed by more than adequate knowledge of both the Odoo API and the resources required to develop the plugin, securing a Gold Partner (Odoo's highest internal metric for services vendors that have dedicated resources in Odoo, communication with Odoo, and make themselves available to support their applications on the client end) for development and API integration.  The budget is broken down clearly, and within range for the hourly development work, and it follows a well laid out 6 week roadmap with specific steps laid out by the week.  There is a clear understanding here of how to deliver the plugin, and what resources it requires, including an understanding that any unknowns regarding the COTI AdaPay API may require extra resources, which will be assigned from existing funding.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers accountability to the community is not in question.  He delivered on a funded proposal in Fund6 and is a member of a Fund7 challenge team.  In addition he lays out a bi-weekly 'check-in' schedule (I suggest he adopts the schedule from his road map -1 week, 2 week, 2 week, 1 week- for check ins), as well as a familiarity with being audited (and proofed) in Github.  On top of all that, he is using Jira tools, which provides audit logs to users.  This is a project that should have no trouble staying on track and transparent.
